Package com.atakmap.android.location.framework

Class LocationProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.atakmap.android.location.framework.LocationProvider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Disposable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ManualPlacedLocationProvider
    public abstract class LocationProvider
extends java.lang.Object
implements Disposable
    An base implementation of a location provider able to be registered with the location manager. The concrete implementation of this should provide for both polling as well as callback for the last reported location.

        public LocationProvider()

    • Method Detail

      • getUniqueIdentifier

        @NonNull
public abstract java.lang.String getUniqueIdentifier()
        Used to identify the provider when the user selects it for use in the system.
        Returns:
        the suggested return is a constant unique identifier for the specific implementation.

      • getTitle

        @NonNull
public abstract java.lang.String getTitle()
        A freetext title used to describe to the user the actual name of the location provider capability.
        Returns:
        a text string not guaranteed to be unique.

      • getDescription

        @NonNull
public abstract java.lang.String getDescription()
        A freetext description used to describe to the user the actual location provider.
        Returns:
        a text string not guaranteed to be unique.

      • getDetail

        public java.lang.String getDetail​(int detail)
        Provide a detail given a DETAIL_* or null if the detail is known known
        Returns:
        the product identifier or null if not known.

      • getLastUpdated

        public final long getLastUpdated()
        Based on the system real time clock and is only accurate during comparisons with other location providers. This should not be used to calculate time AND is not impacted by changes to the system time.
        Returns:
        a monotonic increasing number in milliseconds

      • getSourceCategory

        @NonNull
public abstract java.lang.String getSourceCategory()
        Return the source of the location provider which is required to be one of the defined strings in the return.
        Returns:
        one of "INTERNAL", "SERIAL", "NETWORK", "FUSED", "UNKNOWN", "USER"

      • getSource

        @NonNull
public abstract java.lang.String getSource()
        A human readable name for the source which preferably will be as short as possible. A suggestive size is under 15 characters.
        Returns:
        the human readable name

      • getSourceColor

        public abstract int getSourceColor()
        A suggestive color for the source which will be used during rendering.
        Returns:
        the suggestive ARGB color such as defined in java as Color.YELLOW or -1 if the default should be used.

      • setEnabled

        public abstract void setEnabled​(boolean enabled)
        Allow for the provider to be notified if it should be enabled or disabled. This can be used to free up resources when the provider is not enabled.
        Parameters:
        enabled - the status.

      • getEnabled

        public abstract boolean getEnabled()
        Query the location provider to see if it is enabled or disabled. This might not always be a direct reflection of the call to setEnabled(boolean) as there might be additional hardware required that is missing before a provider can be considered enabled.
        Returns:
        the status of the location provider.

      • getLastReportedLocation

        public final Location getLastReportedLocation()
        Return the last location reported by the location provider.
        Returns:
        the last location or null if no location ever reported.

      • register

        public final void register​(LocationProvider.LocationSubscriber subscriber)
        Register a subscriber for the location provider.
        Parameters:
        subscriber - the subscriber

      • getSubscribers

        public final java.util.Set<LocationProvider.LocationSubscriber> getSubscribers()
        Gets the set of all registered LocationSubscribers
        Returns:
        Set of registered LocationSubscribers

      • unregister

        public final void unregister​(LocationProvider.LocationSubscriber subscriber)
        Unregister a subscriber for the location provider.
        Parameters:
        subscriber - the subscriber

      • fireLocationChanged

        protected final void fireLocationChanged​(Location location)
        Call when a new location is provided. Please note that a new location object should be provided each time this is called.
        Parameters:
        location - the most recent location

      • fireDataChanged

        protected final void fireDataChanged​(java.lang.String type,
                                     byte[] data)
        Call when new raw data is provided.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of the data to help a client better process it for example "NMEA"
        data - the byte array that is the data and it is up to the client to process it
